title: Ewing's sarcoma
summary: Ewing sarcoma is a type of cancer that may be a bone sarcoma or a soft-tissue sarcoma.[1] Symptoms may include swelling and pain at the site of the tumor, fever, and a bone fracture.[1] The most common areas where it begins are the legs, pelvis, and chest wall.[3] In about 25% of cases, the cancer has already spread to other parts of the body at the time of diagnosis.[3] Complications may include a pleural effusion or paraplegia.[2]
